mdRecord.dcterms:title: Battles of Mexico: survey of the line of operations of the U.S Army, under the command of Major General Winfield Scott, on the 19th. & 20th. August & on the 8th. 12th. & 13th. September, 1847 / made by Maj. Turnbull, Capt. McClellan & Lieut. Hardcastle, Topl. Engs. ; drawn by Capt. McClellan
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: McClellan, George B. (George Brinton), 1826-1885
mdRecord.dcterms:contributor: United States. Army. Corps of Topographical Engineers.
mdRecord.dcterms:extent: 60 x 86 cm. on sheet 68 x 97 cm.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: This version of the map does not have an imprint or a copyright statement.
"Bureau Corps T. Engineers, 3d. March 1848. Examined & approved J.J. Abert Col. Corps T.E." -- At lower left.
Inset (separate scale): Part of the Valley of Mexico.
Includes positions and numbers of troops and casualty statistics for the battles of Contreras, Churubusco, Molino del Rey, and Chapultepec.
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Has several marginal tears.
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: In Flat-folio Map Cabinet.
